sink.map

Class MapActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • sink.core.SceneActor
        • sink.map.MapActor

  • public class MapActor
extends SceneActor
    The MapActor Class

    The MapActor is a SceneActor that can be used as a static tile, animated tile, animated actor or as a plain actor.
    1.For using it as a Static Tile use:
    MapActor(TextureRegion region, int row, int col, int id, int tileSize)
    2.For using it as a Animated Tile/Actor use:
    MapActor(Animation a, int row, int col, int id, int tileSize)
    3.For using it as a plain Actor use:
    MapActor(int row, int col, int tileSize)
    It has many important methods like moveTo, moveBy, collides, intersects, getCenterX, getCenterY Note: Only Use setPositionXY and SetPositionRC on this actor do not use the Actor's setPosition method as it causes problems

    Author:
    pyros2097

      • translateWithoutAcc

        public void translateWithoutAcc(float speedX,
                       float speedY,
                       float delta)
        Translate actor in a direction of speed without stopping. Actor moves in constants speed set without acceleration
        Parameters:
        speedX - axis-X speed
        speedY - axis-Y speed
        delta - the delta time for accurate speed

      • getCenterX

        public static float getCenterX(float eventX,
               float objectWidth)
        Get center x point of an object

        EXAMPLE
        Object's width 200, and we touched the screen in 400 in position X, and we want to center the object according to our touch position. (200 / 2 = 100 then 400 - 100), so 300 our center position
